item.title: EPA announces $5.6 Million for Environmental Improvements on Tribal Lands in Nevada
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO – Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced $5.6 million in funding for Nevada tribes to support environmental programs, drinking water and wastewater infrastructure and community education.
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: EPA requires TIMET to improve chemical safety at Henderson facility
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: U.S. EPA recognizes five WaterSense award winners in California and Nevada for 2016
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: U.S. EPA awards more than $1.6 million in environmental research fellowships to 13 students in Arizona, California, Hawaii, and Nevada
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO – Today the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced more than $1.6 million in Science to Achieve Results (STAR) graduate fellowships for 13 students at universities in Arizona, California, Hawaii, and Nevada.
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: EPA takes action to protect agricultural workers in Nevada
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO -- The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency fined Moana Nursery in Reno, Nev. $2,640 and issued a warning to Genoa Trees and Landscape Materials of Minden, Nev. for violating federal pesticide worker safety laws.
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: U.S. EPA Awards Nearly $2.7 Million to Assess and Clean Up Contamination in Arizona, California and Nevada
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: U.S. EPA Awards $550,000 to Assess and Clean Up Contamination in Henderson, Nevada
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO – Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced that the City of Henderson, Nev., will receive $550,000 in federal funds to support revitalization and redevelopment along the Boulder Highway Corridor.
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: U.S. EPA Awards $1 Million for Environmental Workforce Development and Job Training in California and Nevada
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: News Brief: EPA and Nevada DEP propose permit modification to allow expansion at US Ecology near Beatty
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO — The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the Nevada Division of Environmental Protection have proposed modifications to two permits that would allow a 47.3-acre expansion of US Ecology’s hazardous waste facility 11 miles outside Beatty, Nev.
item.dc:creator: Region 09
